content.user_title: Automate PDF extraction and form filling
content.value_statement: You need reliable PDF processing across text, tables, and forms. This skill provides scripts and guidance to extract, validate, and fill PDFs at scale.
actual_capabilities: Detect whether a PDF has fillable form fields using pypdf
Extract field IDs, types, pages, and option values into JSON
Convert PDF pages to scaled PNG images for visual analysis
Validate label and entry bounding boxes for overlaps and text height
Fill fillable forms with validated values and regenerate appearances
Add text annotations to non fillable PDFs with coordinate transforms
limitations: Requires local Python dependencies and system tools such as pdf2image and poppler
Non fillable forms require manual bounding box creation
Annotation font size and color may render inconsistently across viewers
Does not perform OCR automatically for scanned PDFs

use_cases.title: Batch PDF text extraction
use_cases.description: Extract text and tables from large PDF sets for reporting and downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Fill employee onboarding forms

use_cases.title: Annotate scanned forms

prompt_templates.title: Check fillable fields

output: Detected 14 fillable fields and validated field IDs and pages
Filled fields on pages 1 to 3 with the provided values
Saved the completed PDF as registration_filled.pdf

best_practices: Run bounding box validation before adding annotations
Use extracted field IDs and pages as the source of truth
Review output in multiple PDF viewers for rendering differences
anti_patterns: Skip validation images and trust unverified boxes
Use arbitrary checkbox values instead of extracted options
Assume OCR is handled without adding OCR steps

faq.question: What PDF tools and libraries are compatible?
faq.answer: The scripts use pypdf, pdfplumber, pdf2image, and poppler utilities such as pdftotext and pdfimages.

faq.question: Are there limits on PDF size or page count?
faq.answer: Large PDFs may require batching and more memory, so process pages in chunks when needed.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, call the scripts from your workflow and pass input and output paths as arguments.

faq.question: How is data handled during processing?
faq.answer: Processing happens locally on your files, and no network transfer is required by the scripts.

faq.question: What should I do if fields do not appear?
faq.answer: Run the field extraction again, confirm page numbers, and verify bounding boxes with validation images.

faq.question: How does this compare to OCR tools?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on structured PDFs; OCR is a separate step for scanned documents.
